titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Oversize Ms. Codex 728: Commentary on the Clementines

availability.licence: These images and the content of Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts Oversize Ms. Codex 728: Commentary on the Clementines are free of known copyright restrictions and in the public domain. notesStmt.note: Title supplied by cataloger (Zacour-Hirsch); author attribution in upper margin of first leaf (f. 1r).
Incipit: Magnifice bonitatis mireque pietatis vira domino Johannii (f. 1r).

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: Commentary on part of the Corpus Juris Canonici.

supportDesc.foliation: Parchment, 52; [1-52]; modern foliation in pencil, lower left recto.

layoutDesc.layout: Written in 2 columns of 80 lines; frame-ruled in lead.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in a Gothic book script by a single hand, with many marginal notes in different hands.

decoDesc.decoNote: 10-line red and blue puzzle initial with red and purple ornamentation (f. 1r); 2-line alternating red and blue initials with red or purple contrasting ornamentation; numerous manicules in different styles throughout.

origin.p: Written in southern France or Spain, possibly Aragon, in the mid-14th century (Zacour-Hirsch).
